page.title: 04Kingswood Farm _ Cardinham
page.content: There are 60 Friesian cows which are milked twice a day in an abreast parlour. The milk is collected at 8 in the morning by tanker and taken to the Lostwithiel factory. There are some followers_ that is young cows and about 150 beef animals. These are mostly Hereford/Friesian crosses although there are also some Limousin, Charolais and Simmental animals All these animals are housed in the winter because it is too cold for them outside. There are 420 ewes and their lambs. The sheep only come inside at night while they are lambing and until the lambs are about 12 hours old. Twin lambs are all put in plastic coats with numbers on. This is to help protect them from the rain.
